definitions: small donkey used for carrying loads especially in mountainous regions
examples: The burro carried supplies up the steep mountain trail
Several burros grazed peacefully in the desert landscape

definitions: hole or tunnel dug by an animal for shelter or protection
examples: The rabbit disappeared quickly into its burrow beneath the tree
Prairie dogs create complex burrow systems underground for their colonies

definitions: person who manages financial affairs at a school or college
examples: The bursar explained the tuition payment options to new students
Students should contact the bursar for questions about billing

definitions: grant of money given to students to help pay for education
examples: She received a bursary to cover her university textbook expenses
The foundation offers several bursaries to students from low-income families

definitions: action of placing something underground especially a dead body in a grave
examples: The burying of the time capsule was scheduled for noon
Traditional burying practices vary greatly between different cultures worldwide

definitions: tall fur military hat worn by certain ceremonial guards and soldiers
examples: The palace guard stood motionless wearing his traditional black busby
Each busby contains over one hundred individual pieces of fur

definitions: unit of dry measure equal to eight gallons or thirty-two quarts
examples: The farmer sold apples by the bushel at the market
One bushel of wheat typically weighs about sixty pounds

definitions: member of indigenous hunting and gathering peoples of southern Africa
examples: The bushman shared traditional knowledge about desert survival techniques
Ancient bushman paintings can still be seen on cave walls

definitions: person engaged in commercial or industrial business activities for profit
examples: The successful businessperson attended networking events every month
Many businessperson types struggle to maintain work-life balance effectively

definitions: woman who works in business especially in a senior position
examples: The businesswoman founded three successful technology companies before thirty
Several businesswoman leaders spoke at the annual conference yesterday

definitions: person who performs music or entertainment in public places for donations
examples: The talented busker played guitar outside the subway station
Many famous musicians started their careers as busker performers

definitions: sculpture of person's head shoulders and chest
sudden police operation to arrest criminals
examples: The marble bust of the founder stood in the library
An ancient Roman bust was discovered during the excavation
The drug bust resulted in several arrests last night
Police conducted a major bust at the illegal gambling den

definitions: large heavy bird found in open country of Europe Africa and Asia
examples: The great bustard is one of the heaviest flying birds
Conservation efforts helped increase the bustard population in recent years

definitions: person or thing that breaks or destroys something especially in compounds
examples: The union buster tried to prevent workers from organizing effectively
This myth buster show examines common misconceptions about science

definitions: excited activity and movement involving many people in one place
examples: The morning bustle at the train station was overwhelming
She enjoyed the bustle of city life after years in quiet countryside

definitions: colorless gas used as fuel in cigarette lighters and portable stoves
examples: The camping stove runs on small butane canisters for convenience
Butane burns more efficiently than propane in warmer temperatures

definitions: person especially a woman who dresses and behaves in a traditionally masculine way
examples: The butch mechanic expertly repaired motorcycles at the shop
Her butch appearance challenged traditional gender expression norms

definitions: person who cuts and sells meat in a shop
person who kills brutally or indiscriminately
examples: The local butcher recommended the best cuts for grilling
She asked the butcher to prepare special sausages for the party
History remembers him as a butcher who showed no mercy
The dictator was called a butcher for his violent actions

definitions: act of killing animals and preparing their meat for sale or consumption
examples: The butchering of cattle requires specific skills and tools
Traditional butchering methods have been passed down through generations

definitions: shop where meat is sold by a butcher
cruel and unnecessary killing of many people
examples: The new butchery offers organic and locally sourced meats
She stopped at the butchery to buy lamb for dinner
The battlefield was a scene of complete butchery and devastation
Historians condemned the butchery of innocent civilians during war

definitions: chief male servant of a household who manages other staff members
examples: The butler announced each guest as they arrived for dinner
In mystery novels the butler is often a prime suspect

definitions: isolated flat-topped hill with steep sides found in western North America
examples: The red sandstone butte rose dramatically from the desert floor
Native Americans considered the ancient butte a sacred landmark

definitions: small wild plant with bright yellow cup-shaped flowers found in fields
examples: Children picked buttercup flowers to make cheerful spring bouquets
The meadow was covered with buttercup blooms in early summer

definitions: flying insect with large colorful wings and slender body
swimming stroke with both arms moving together in circular motion
examples: A monarch butterfly landed gently on the garden flowers
The butterfly emerged from its chrysalis with wet wings
She won the race swimming butterfly in record time
Learning the butterfly stroke requires significant upper body strength

definitions: slightly sour liquid left after butter is churned from cream
examples: Buttermilk makes pancakes extra fluffy and tender when baking
She drank cold buttermilk to cool down on hot days

definitions: North American walnut tree producing edible nuts
type of winter squash with tan skin and orange flesh
examples: The butternut tree provided shade and nuts every autumn
Woodworkers prize butternut lumber for its attractive grain patterns
She made butternut soup with sage for the holiday dinner
Roasted butternut cubes make a healthy and delicious side dish

definitions: purchase by a company of its own shares from the stock market
examples: The corporation announced a major stock buyback program yesterday
Share buyback plans often boost stock prices for remaining shareholders

definitions: act of obtaining something in exchange for payment of money
examples: Holiday buying reaches its peak during the December shopping season
Smart buying requires research and price comparison before purchasing

definitions: purchase of a controlling share in a company or business
examples: The private equity firm completed a leveraged buyout yesterday
Employee buyout options allowed workers to own the company

definitions: low continuous humming sound made by insects or machines
atmosphere of excitement and activity or interested talk
examples: The buzz of bees filled the summer garden air
An electrical buzz came from the malfunctioning fluorescent light
There was considerable buzz about the new restaurant opening
The buzz around campus focused on the upcoming concert

definitions: large bird of prey known for feeding on dead animals
examples: A buzzard circled high above looking for carrion below
Several buzzards perched on fence posts along the highway

definitions: electrical device that makes a buzzing sound as a signal
examples: The game show buzzer sounded when time ran out
Press the apartment buzzer to let visitors into the building

definitions: fish or other marine creatures caught unintentionally while fishing for other species
examples: Fishing nets were modified to reduce harmful bycatch significantly
The bycatch included several endangered sea turtle species unfortunately

definitions: automatic advancement to next round without playing in tournament
informal way of saying goodbye when leaving
examples: The top seed received a bye in the first round
Our team got a bye this week in the playoffs
She waved and said a quick bye before leaving
The children shouted bye as the school bus departed

definitions: belonging to an earlier time that has passed and will not return
examples: The museum displayed artifacts from bygone eras of history
She collected postcards depicting bygone scenes of the city

definitions: rule made by a company or society to control its members' actions
examples: The new bylaw prohibited parking on residential streets overnight
Club members voted to change the bylaw about membership fees

definitions: something produced during the manufacture or processing of something else
examples: Molasses is a byproduct of sugar refining from sugarcane
The chemical reaction created several unexpected byproduct compounds

definitions: person who is present at an event but does not take part
examples: Several bystander witnesses saw the accident happen at the intersection
The bystander called for help when she saw someone collapse

definitions: unit of computer information equal to eight binary digits or bits
examples: The file size was measured in millions of byte units
Each byte can represent one character of text data

definitions: minor road or path that is not used by many people
examples: They discovered a scenic byway through the mountain valley
The old byway connected two villages before the highway opened

definitions: small group of people united in secret plot usually for political purposes
examples: The cabal met secretly to plan their takeover strategy
Historians uncovered evidence of a cabal within the government

definitions: small structure at a beach or pool for changing clothes or shade
examples: They rented a cabana for the day at the resort
The beachside cabana provided welcome relief from the sun

definitions: nightclub or restaurant providing entertainment with singing dancing and comedy performances
examples: The cabaret featured talented singers performing jazz standards nightly
They enjoyed dinner and a show at the Paris cabaret

definitions: round vegetable with thick green or purple leaves eaten cooked or raw
examples: She made coleslaw using fresh cabbage from the garden
Red cabbage adds color and nutrients to winter salads
